content.title: Minimum Length in Quantum Gravity
content.summary: Multiple independent approaches to quantum gravity suggest the existence of a minimum measurable length of order the Planck length. This concept fundamentally challenges the continuity assumption of spacetime.

core_argument.heuristic: Any attempt to probe distances smaller than the Planck length requires concentrating energy in a region so small that a black hole forms, hiding the measurement result behind an event horizon.
core_argument.mathematical: Δx ≥ ℓ_P arises from combining Heisenberg uncertainty (Δx ~ ℏ/Δp) with gravitational collapse (Schwarzschild radius r_s ~ GE/c⁴ ~ GΔp/c³)

theoretical_origins.mechanism: Strings have minimum size ~ℓ_s ≥ ℓ_P. Cannot probe sub-string scales.
theoretical_origins.formula: ℓ_s = √(α') where α' is string tension parameter
theoretical_origins.detail: T-duality maps small radii to large: physics at R is equivalent to physics at α'/R

theoretical_origins.mechanism: Area and volume operators have discrete eigenvalues with minimum non-zero value.
theoretical_origins.detail: Spacetime is fundamentally discrete, made of 'atoms of geometry'

theoretical_origins.mechanism: Modified commutation relations lead to minimum position uncertainty.
theoretical_origins.formula: ΔxΔp ≥ ℏ/2 × (1 + β(Δp)²) implies Δx_min = ℏ√β
theoretical_origins.detail: Parameter β expected to be of order ℓ_P²/ℏ²

theoretical_origins.mechanism: Smallest black hole has Schwarzschild radius ~ℓ_P. Cannot resolve interior.
theoretical_origins.detail: Sub-Planck probing creates micro black holes

theoretical_origins.mechanism: Planck length as observer-independent minimum length alongside c.
theoretical_origins.formula: Modified Lorentz transformations preserve both c and ℓ_P
theoretical_origins.detail: Requires modified dispersion relations at high energy

spacetime_structure: Continuum spacetime is an approximation valid above Planck scale
Spacetime may be discrete, foamy, or fundamentally non-geometric
Topology changes may occur at Planck scale
physics_modifications: Uncertainty principle modified at high energies
Standard quantum field theory breaks down
Lorentz symmetry may be deformed or violated
UV divergences may be naturally regulated
cosmology: Big Bang singularity may be resolved

experimental_constraints.direct_tests: Not possible - Planck length 10¹⁹ times smaller than current resolution

indirect_tests.status: Fermi satellite constraints: no dispersion at ~10⁻¹⁸ ℓ_P level
GZK cutoff observations constrain Lorentz violation

open_questions: Is minimum length exactly ℓ_P or modified by O(1) factors?
How is Lorentz invariance preserved or modified?
What is the correct mathematical description of discrete spacetime?
Can minimum length effects leave observable cosmological signatures?
